metadata.title: Inches to Centimeters Converter (in to cm) - Official Standard
metadata.description: Convert inches to centimeters using the exact 2.54 multiplication factor defined by international agreement. Get NIST-traceable results for engineering, science, and everyday use.

introduction: Use this inches to centimeters converter for precise, reliable translations based on the official international standard.
Every conversion uses the exact formula of 1 inch = 2.54 centimeters, ensuring your results are accurate for technical drawings, scientific data, and international commerce.
Avoid the ambiguity of rounded values and gain confidence knowing your measurements are backed by the same standards used by NIST and other global metrology institutions.
methodology: To convert inches to centimeters, the calculator multiplies the inch value by exactly 2.54. [1]
This conversion factor is not an approximation; it is the exact definition of the international inch as established by the 1959 International Yard and Pound Agreement.

This standard unified measurements between the United States, the United Kingdom, and other Commonwealth nations, making it the definitive figure for all modern scientific and industrial applications. [2]
examples: Product Design: A 13-inch laptop screen dimension is converted to 33.02 centimeters for international specification sheets.
Apparel: A 34-inch waist size for a pair of jeans is equivalent to 86.36 centimeters in European sizing charts.
Printing: An 8.5 x 11 inch standard paper size is precisely 21.59 x 27.94 centimeters, ensuring document formats are consistent globally.

faqs.question: What is the exact formula to convert inches to centimeters?
faqs.answer: The official formula is: centimeters = inches Ã— 2.54. This is an exact definition, not a rounded number. [1]

faqs.question: How many centimeters are in an inch?
faqs.answer: There are exactly 2.54 centimeters in one international inch. This has been the formal standard since 1959. [2]

faqs.question: Is this conversion factor always the same?
faqs.answer: Yes, for the international inch used in all modern contexts, the factor is always 2.54. Older, historical definitions of the inch are no longer in use for trade or science.

faqs.question: Why is an exact conversion factor important?
faqs.answer: An exact factor eliminates cumulative errors in high-precision fields like aerospace engineering, electronics manufacturing, and scientific research, ensuring global interoperability.

citations.label: NIST Special Publication 811: Guide for the Use of the International System of Units (SI)
citations.summary: This guide from the National Institute of Standards and Technology specifies the inch as exactly equal to 2.54 centimeters.

citations.label: Federal Register Notice (July 1, 1959): Refinement of Values for the Yard and the Pound
citations.summary: The official U.S. government document that established the international yard as 0.9144 meters, which defines the inch as exactly 2.54 centimeters.

summary: The universally accepted conversion is 1 inch = 2.54 centimeters.
To convert any value from inches to centimeters, multiply by 2.54.
This standard is defined by international agreement and is used for all scientific, industrial, and commercial purposes.

glossary.definition: The standard unit of length defined as exactly 2.54 centimeters by the 1959 International Yard and Pound Agreement.
A unit of length in the International System of Units (SI), equal to one hundredth of a meter.
The National Institute of Standards and Technology, a U.S. agency that promotes and maintains measurement standards.
